result.execSummary:
The defendant David L. Meinders was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Assessment, counseling, and treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
DNA sample but surcharge is remitted.
Gun/Savage Rifle used in this matter is to be forfeited to Sheriff's dept.
Any other guns in possession of the defendant are to be surrendered to the Sheriff's dept. or his Son.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Shirley.
Case Called: 9:31
State appears by ADA Elisabeth Gramer.  Def appears with Atty Zachary Glascock.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW
PLEA: Count 1>>Felon in Possession of a Firearm>>No Contest
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: WS; Probation for 12 months with Conditions of: Assessment/Counseling/Treatment deemed appropriate by agent, FTE/School, DNA sample and surcharge if not already done, CC.  Gun/Savage Rifle used in this matter is to be forfeited to Sheriff's Dept, any other guns in possession of the defendant are to be surrendered to the Sheriff's Dept or his son. New DNA surcharge is remitted.
